title: Remove Memories montage and photo references from Valentine flow

requirements.summary: Remove the Memories montage scene so user photos are never shown or reachable in the Valentine UI.
acceptanceCriteria: The app no longer renders or links to the Memories montage scene in any flow/state.
No photo images from `/assets/memories/*` are referenced by any React component at runtime.
The Valentine experience still includes the initial letter scene, the Yes/No outcome scenes, and the proposal scene.

file_operations.description: Remove the Memories scene from the scene union/state machine and eliminate any conditional rendering/navigation that would take the user to a Memories montage, keeping initial letter, Yes/No outcomes, and proposal scenes intact.

requirements.summary: Update the Yes outcome so Continue transitions directly to the proposal scene, removing any memories step and its controls.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking “Yes” then “Continue” takes the user to the proposal scene.
No intermediate scene/state named “memories” remains in the flow logic.
Keyboard navigation or UI controls previously used for the montage are no longer available in production builds.

file_operations.description: Change the Yes outcome Continue handler to set the scene directly to the proposal scene, and remove any remaining 'memories' scene/state transitions so no montage-related controls can be reached.

requirements.summary: Delete montage-specific component code and remove montage-only styling/imports so the project builds cleanly with no unused references.
acceptanceCriteria: `MemoriesMontageScene` is no longer imported or referenced by `ValentineInvitePage`.
Montage-related CSS selectors (e.g., `.montage-*`) are removed if they are no longer used anywhere else.
The project builds without TypeScript errors related to the removed montage feature.

file_operations.description: Remove the Memories montage component implementation entirely, including its photo imports/paths and keyboard navigation logic.
Remove the `MemoriesMontageScene` import and any JSX branches/handlers referencing it; ensure the remaining scene union/types contain no 'memories' value.
Remove montage-specific CSS selectors (the `.montage-*` block) that are no longer used after deleting the montage scene, while keeping the existing romantic theme and cinematic effects intact.
